newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore rubber ignores Thai news, trade quiet.
newsitem.headline: Singapore rubber ignores Thai news, trade quiet.

text.p: The Singapore rubber market on Thursday shrugged off as a non-event the announcement by Thailand it was raising its intervention price for RSS3 grade rubber to 29 baht a kg from 27.50 baht, dealers said.
"The only news in the market was the Thai news. But no one traded on the announcement," a dealer said.
"It's totally discounted by the trade. Nobody bothered with it," another dealer said, adding the rest of the market was trading about five baht lower.
Holidays in Indonesia and Malaysia added to the gloomy mood in the market, the traders said.
"I have not received any calls from the big boys so far. We'll see what happens in the afternoon," a trader said.
"There was no business done in the morning. It was pretty dull so far," a dealer added. Traders said firmer prices in Japan may give a slight boost to prices in the afternoon session.

At 0430 GMT, June RSS3 was indicated unchanged at 108.00 U.S. cents a kg. June RSS1 was indicated at 156.00-158.00 Singapore cents (US$1.08-$1.09) a kg from 156.00 cents. June TSR20 was indicated at 151.25 Singapore cents (US$1.05) a kg from 150.00 cents. -- (US$1-S$1.44) Rene Pastor (65-8703305)
